Article Title: Truth behind man carrying geese which led to Haitians eating pets rumour revealed
Article Text:
Woman behind rumor expresses regret

A viral photo of a man carrying two geese which stirred controversy and confusion after being linked to recent claims by former President Donald Trump . The image, which has been widely shared online, was initially used to support rumors that Haitian immigrants in Ohio were eating pets. However, officials have clarified the real story behind the photograph.According to TMZ, the Ohio Division of Wildlife has confirmed that the man seen in the photo was not involved in any nefarious activities.Instead, he was simply collecting two geese that had been struck by a car in Columbus, Ohio. The location of the incident is significant because it is about 45 minutes away from Springfield, where recent rumors about Haitian immigrants originated.The Franklin County Wildlife Office explained to TMZ that while claiming animal carcasses usually requires documentation, geese are an exception. Therefore, the man was legally allowed to pick up the geese without needing additional paperwork. There is also no evidence to suggest that the man is an immigrant or has any intentions of consuming the geese.The confusion began with a misleading video titled “Haitian Woman Eats Neighbor's Cat in Springfield,” which falsely claimed that a Haitian woman was caught eating a pet. This video, as verified by USA Today, was actually from an unrelated incident in Canton involving Allexis Ferrell, who has no known ties to Haiti. Springfield City Manager Bryan Heck quickly debunked the rumors, stating, “There is no evidence supporting the claims of Haitian immigrants harming or eating cats or other pets in Springfield.”Despite the lack of evidence, Trump and Ohio Senator JD Vance have perpetuated these false claims. During a recent debate, Trump suggested that Haitian immigrants were causing disruptions and eating pets in Springfield. At a rally, Trump further claimed that immigrants were taking geese from local parks and lakes. "A recording of 911 calls shows residents reporting that the migrants are walking off with the town’s geese. They’re taking the geese. You know where the geese are? In the park, in the lake. And even walking off with their pets," the former President said.Erika Lee, whose Facebook post about the supposed pet-eating incidents sparked the controversy, has expressed regret over the situation. Lee’s post, which was based on second-hand information, was not intended to spread misinformation . “I’m not a racist,” Lee told NBC News, emphasizing that her intention was not to fuel racial or xenophobic narratives. Lee, who is mixed race and a member of the LGBTQ community, regretted how her post escalated into a national controversy.The photo of the man with the geese was mistakenly associated with these rumors, but it has now been confirmed that he was simply handling geese involved in an accident.
Article Summary: The Ohio Division of Wildlife has confirmed that the man seen in the photo was not involved in any nefarious activities. Instead, he was simply collecting two geese that had been struck by a car in Columbus, Ohio. The location of the incident is significant because it is about 45 minutes away from Springfield, where recent rumors about Haitian immigrants originated.

Article Title: When Laura Loomer said she would 'gladly' become Trump's press secretary
Article Text: In a 2023 podcast clip, Laura Loomer , currently under fire from both Democrats and Republicans for her racially charged "curry smell in the White House" remarks aimed at Vice President Kamala Harris , can be heard saying she would gladly take on the role of Donald Trump’s Press Secretary. Article Title: 4 senior ISIS members, including top leader and chief bombmaker with $5 million reward, killed
Article Text: Four senior ISIS leaders, including the group’s top bombmaker who had a $5 million US bounty, were killed in a joint US-Iraqi raid in western Iraq last month. The August 29 operation also claimed the life of Ahmad Hamid Husayn Abd-al-Jalil al-Ithawi , the group's top operations leader in Iraq. The raid targeted key figures involved in ISIS’ operational and military planning as part of a broader effort to weaken the group’s capabilities.According to US Central Command ( CENTCOM ), al-Ithawi was killed alongside three other senior leaders: Abu Hammam, who managed ISIS operations in western Iraq; Abu Ali al-Tunisi, the group’s chief bombmaker; and Shakir al-Issawi, who led military operations in the same region.Al-Tunisi, notorious for his role in bombmaking and weapons development, had been a high-value target with a $5 million reward offered by the USCENTCOM said the operation was crucial in disrupting ISIS' ability to plan and carry out attacks on both Iraqi civilians and US forces in the region. “This operation served to degrade their ability to plan, organize, and conduct attacks,” the statement read, as reported by ABC News.The mission resulted in the deaths of 14 ISIS operatives, though seven American service members were injured, five of them in combat-related incidents. Despite these casualties, the mission was considered a success, continuing efforts to dismantle the remaining leadership of ISIS.The US currently has about 2,500 troops stationed in Iraq, working alongside Iraqi forces in a coalition aimed at defeating ISIS and maintaining stability in the region.
Article Summary: Four senior ISIS leaders, including the group’s top bombmaker who had a $5 million US bounty, were killed in a joint US-Iraqi raid in western Iraq last month. The August 29 operation also claimed the life of Ahmad Hamid Husayn Abd- al-Jalil al-Ithawi, the group's top operations leader in Iraq. Article Title: Haitian Immigrants: 'I am not a racist': Woman who started Haitian rumor regrets how 'it just exploded'
Article Text:
Erika Lee's Facebook post and a misplaced photo

Springfield's Erika Lee has been traced as the ground zero of the rumor that Haitian immigrants are eating pet cats and dogs. The rumor started from her Facebook post which she did not even expect to reach beyond Springfield. To her surprise, her fourth-hand information reached the presidential debate stage as GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump spouted the theory to blame Joe Biden- Kamala Harris administration's immigration policy.Erika told NBC News that she is not a racist and regrets that her Facebook post has snowballed into such a massive controversy. "I'm not a racist. Everybody seems to be turning it into that, and that was not my intent," she said adding that her daughter is half- black and she herself is mixed race and a member of the LGBTQ community.What Erika posted was not her first hand knowledge but something that she heard from her neighbor Kimberly Newton. Newton got the story from a friend whose acquaintance apparently had the first hand story.While Erika Lee's Facebook post became the center of the conspiracy theory, the right-wingers picked a photo of a person carrying ducks and claimed that he was a Haitian immigrant going to eat the geese.Now it has been established that the photo was not from Springfield but from Columbus, which is also in Ohio. The photographer said he posted the photo on Reddit because he thought it was something that does not happen daily that a man carries dead ducks in his hand.Now the Ohio Division of Wildfire has confirmed that the man was actually picking up two geese that were hit in a car accident. There was no evidence that the man is an immigrant or Haitian or had plans to eat the geese.
Article Summary: Springfield's Erika Lee has been traced as the ground zero of the rumor that Haitian immigrants are eating pet cats and dogs. The rumor started from her Facebook post which she did not even expect to reach beyond Springfield. To her surprise, her fourth-hand information reached the presidential debate stage as Donald Trump spouted the theory.

Article Title: 'This plane is going down': California man shouts on plane, threatens to kill everyone
Article Text: A Californian man has been arrested for creating nuisance on a Frontier Airlines flight heading to San Francisco from California. 30-year-old Charles Angel Salva faces 20 years in federal prison if convicted as he assaulted the crew and threatened to kill everyone on the flight -- though initially other passengers thought he was just feeling claustrophobic and wanted to get off the plane.The incident took place early this month.According to federal prosecutors, Silva tampered with the oxygen masks in the overhead compartment in one of the rows. A witness said Salva appeared out of breath and seemed like he wanted to get off the plane. Salva pulled the oxygen masks down and got his hand stuck when a fellow passenger even helped him.Soon after that, Salva started hurling abuses at the flight attendant. Article Title: Jailed former Pakistan PM Imran Khan booked for inciting official to mutiny
Article Text: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan has been booked for inciting government officer to mutiny , and committing 'sedition,' through his social media posts, Dawn reported quoting sources on Saturday.A team from the Federal Investigation Agency ( FIA ), which registered the case against the jailed Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party founder on Friday, recently visited Adiala Jail to question him in relation to a controversial post on his official X account.Minister for Information, Broadcasting, National Heritage, and Culture Attaullah Tarar announced that FIA would investigate the management of the PTI founder's social media accounts. The investigation will focus on allegations that these accounts have been used to incite chaos and anarchy in the country, as well as to undermine national security.“He (the PTI founder) should be ashamed of undermining the national security, inciting people for anarchy and committing the sedition,” the minister said, as reported by APP.He added that there had been a failed attempt to conspire against the sitting chief justice and leaders of other institutions. The posts were aimed at inciting people against two major state institutions, an action he described as highly condemnable.Imran's social media team had posted a video on his X account comparing past and present military leaderships, along with a statement urging people to review a judicial commission report on Pakistan's breakup.“Every Pakistani should study the Hamoodur Rahman Commission Report and get to know who was the true traitor, General Yahya Khan or Sheikh Mujibur Rahman,” said a quote attributed to Imran.The posts also featured images of the current civilian and military leaders, alleging that they had stolen the mandate of Imran’s Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) in the February general elections.
